snippet: When New York Medical College was acquired by Touro College, it switched from a Catholic to a Jewish institution and faced some wary questions.
abstract: Acquisition of New York Medical College in Valhalla, NY, by Touro College, which was founded by Orthodox Rabbi Bernard Lander, brought not only a change in administration but a shift in religious affiliation, from Catholic to Jewish; change raised countless wary questions and fears of a loss of identity; institutions of higher education rarely make such a switch, leaving no playbook for administrators, or students, to follow.
lead_paragraph: When New York Medical College was acquired by Touro College, it switched from a Catholic to a Jewish institution and faced some wary questions.

headline.seo: For New York Medical College, a Learning Curve in Changing Religious Affiliation
headline.main: Ham, Holidays and Other Puzzles as Medical College Shifts Its Religious Affiliation
headline.print_headline: Ham, Holidays and Other Puzzles as Medical College Shifts Its Religious Affiliation
